title: How we pay the bills: Skipping meals and fewer car journeys
description: Three households facing a rise in energy costs tell the BBC how they will make it work.

title: In pictures: Behind the shop facade
description: Photographer Jim Grover looks back at the life of Maurice Dorfman, who ran a fashion shop in Clapham.

title: The Papers: 'April Cruel Day' as prices rise on 'Bleak Friday'
description: Friday's front pages focus on the rise in energy and other household bills.

title: Energy price cap rise: 'I've taken a second job'
description: Daniel Cooke, a construction site manager from Somerset, has taken a second job to pay rising energy bills.

title: Five reasons why prices and bills are going up
description: The soaring cost of living is affecting millions of people in the UK. These five charts explain why.

title: Ukraine war: Cars appear to drive around landmines placed in road near Kyiv
description: A video posted on social media appears to show cars carefully driving around landmines near Kyiv.

title: Ukraine round-up: Russia sets gas deadline for West and troops leave Chernobyl
description: President Putin demands roubles for gas supplies, as Russian troops redeploy around Ukraine.

title: Biden orders 'unprecedented' release of oil reserves
description: The move will add 1m barrels a day to global markets - the largest release of oil reserves in US history.

title: Ukraine war: Russia blocks buses heading to Mariupol, says Ukraine
description: Russia has blocked 45 buses heading to the city to rescue civilians, says Ukraine's deputy prime minister.

title: Shrewsbury maternity scandal: The mothers who died
description: Families of two mothers who died after giving birth at a hospital trust share their stories for the first time.

title: How do you do a face-to-face interview with Zelensky?
description: Zanny Minton Beddoes, editor-in-chief of The Economist, on how she interviewed Ukraine's president.

title: Could Ukraine 'win' the war? And other questions
description: BBC reporters Jenny Hill and Orla Guerin - on the ground - answer your questions about the war in Ukraine.

title: Quiz of the week: Oscars fashion, superyacht and Dyson's new gizmo
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Fifa World Cup Qatar 2022: Everything you need to know about Friday's draw
description: The World Cup draw is on Friday - so how does it work and who could England, Wales or Scotland play?

title: Liz Truss visits India on same day as Sergei Lavrov
description: Rival trips seek to enlist Delhi's support over the war in Ukraine.

title: Tom Parker: 'Incredible' The Wanted singer praised by cancer charities
description: Parker, 33, who died of brain cancer, was "amazing" at raising awareness and funding, charities say.

title: Brothers convicted of stabbing police officers at shopping centre
description: The pair are guilty of wounding police officers during an attack at a West Midlands shopping centre.

title: Tory response to price rises is pathetic – Sir Keir Starmer
description: The Labour leader launches his party's local election campaign with a focus on the cost of living.

title: World Cup 2022: 'Issues of concern' remain for LGBTIQ+ people in Qatar
description: LGBTIQ+ organisations engaging with Fifa over the 2022 Qatar World Cup say "progress has been slow" and "issues of concern" remain.

title: French intelligence chief Vidaud fired over Russian war failings
description: Gen Eric Vidaud loses his job as military intelligence boss for not predicting Russia's invasion.

title: Covid: Last day of free tests in England fuels concern
description: From Friday, most people in England will have to pay if they want to check if they have Covid.

title: Wiltshire police worker jailed over affair with rapist
description: Offender manager Rachel Beale, 53, was supervising the man in a sexual offenders unit.

title: House price growth at 17-year high, says Nationwide
description: Property values continue to surge despite cost of living pressures, the building society says.

title: Will Smith: Chris Rock's first comments since Oscars slap
description: The comedian says he is "still processing what happened" and denies reports he has spoken to Smith.

title: Women's World Cup: England reach final thanks to Wyatt's 129 & Ecclestone's six wickets
description: Danni Wyatt's magnificent century and Sophie Ecclestone's 6-36 propels England to a 137-run defeat of South Africa and into the Women's World Cup final.

title: England reach Women's World Cup final
description: England will face Australia in the final of the Women's World Cup after Danni Wyatt's magnificent century propels the defending champions to victory over South Africa.

title: IndiGo: Man says he hacked airline website to find lost luggage
description: An Indian man said he took matters into his own hands after an airline did not help find his bag.

title: Fifa World Cup Qatar 2022: Can you name the teams to have qualified?
description: The draw for the 22nd Fifa World Cup is taking place on Friday. Can you name all the teams that will be included in it?

title: Pub chain warns of higher food prices as VAT rises
description: With hospitality businesses facing soaring costs, some are warning they will have to increase prices.

title: Ukraine war: Putin being misled by fearful advisers, US says
description: News on Russia's poor military performance is not making it back to Putin, the White House says.

title: Miami Open: Iga Swiatek into semi-finals after 15th consecutive win
description: Poland's Iga Swiatek is into the Miami Open semi-finals after recording her latest win in a superb run of form.

title: The Papers: Childbirth 'not safe' in England and Beckham raid
description: Thursday's front pages focus on fallout of the Shrewsbury and Telford NHS Trust maternity scandal.

title: Ukraine war: Mariupol's refugees carry wounds of battered city
description: Residents who have escaped the besieged city are trying to leave behind memories of its destruction.

title: Ramadan 2022: How Premier League football is evolving to help Muslim players
description: Premier League players may need to break their Ramadan fast during evening matches, so how is football evolving to accommodate Muslim players?

title: Formula 1: Las Vegas to host grand prix from 2023 - third yearly race in United States
description: Formula 1 will have a third race in the USA from next year after securing a deal for a Las Vegas Grand Prix.
